oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Smith School
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Christine School; Market Street School; Reudelhuber, Christine; Smith School;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Originally known as the Market Street School when it opened in 1872, it was Memphis' first permanent public school building. The name was changed to Smith School in 1878 to honor a member of the school board. In 1920, the name was changed again to Christine School, in honor of Miss Christine "Annie" Reudelhuber. pictured here in one of her signature black hats. She was principal of the school from 1882 until her death in 1920.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Digital Image ©2011, Memphis Public Library & Information Center. All rights reserved.
